result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Philip Essel

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Philip Essel not in court - authorization on file.  Attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz in court for Philip Essel.  Attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for State of Wisconsin. Called @ 2:38 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for adjourned initial appearance. Record by Atty. Lochowicz as to charges and penalties. State provides offer. Atty. enters not guilty plea, reserves rights and asks for status hearing.
Status conference scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Philip Essel in court.  Attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for State of Wisconsin. Called @ 1:45 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for adjourned initial appearance. Record by the Defendant who is not eligible for SPD, but brought motion for appointment of counsel. Court reviews motion and grants Court appointed attorney. Defendant to go down to collections department to get his attorney and sign up for payments. Matter set out about 30 days. Court in recess.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.
*AMENDED 8/29/22: NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH M.R.O. dob 7-23-1960. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party.*

Defendant Philip Essel in court.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not qualify for SPD. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Complaint read by court. Defendant's wife is present and makes statement asking for contact. Defendant given MFAC paperwork. State is not objecting to lift no contact. Amended to No violent contact with victim. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery

records.addlTxt:
*AMENDED 8/29/22: NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH M.R.O. dob 7-23-1960, OR RESIDENCE. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party.*

Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH M.R.O. dob 7-23-1960 or RESIDENCE. If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant Philip Essel in court. Andrew Herrman for the State of Wisconsin. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Right to attorney, defendant given attorney options form and referred to SPD. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
